column2: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol used to query and manage directory services (users, groups, resources); LDAP injection is when crafted input alters LDAP queries against the directory.
Decoy files planted to lure attackers; can attract interaction, trigger alerts when accessed, and support monitoring/visibility of access events.

A social engineering attack where an attacker impersonates something legitimate to trick a victim into revealing information or performing an action (distinct from spoofing, which is identity/endpoint impersonation).
PDP (Policy Decision Point) decides whether access is allowed based on policy/context; PEP (Policy Enforcement Point) enforces that decision by allowing, blocking, or conditioning access.

SMTPS is SMTP over implicit TLS (historically port 465, often framed as legacy in basic exams) while STARTTLS upgrades an existing plaintext SMTP connection to TLS; S/MIME is content-level email encryption/signing and DKIM is email authentication/integrity, not transport encryption.
Bluesnarfing is unauthorized access/exfiltration of data from a Bluetooth device, while Bluejacking is sending unsolicited messages to nearby Bluetooth devices (typically nuisance, not data theft).
